About Cost of Debt Analysis
What is Cost of Debt?

The cost of debt is the effective rate that a company pays on its borrowed funds. It includes both the interest rate and tax benefits.

Pre-tax vs After-tax

Pre-tax cost shows the raw interest expense, while after-tax cost accounts for tax deductibility of interest payments.

Why It Matters
  • Helps in capital structure decisions
  • Compares different financing options
  • Evaluates tax benefits of debt
  • Supports investment decisions
